etymology.description: ideogram: 2/4 屮 or 木 + 日 + 月 — the sun rising above the ground while the waning moon is still in the sky (morning).
etymology.interpretation: Sun and moon together picture the moment of daybreak, when the sun rises as the moon fades. Later historical shapes introduced elements like river or boat and were sometimes reanalyzed phono-semantically, but the modern form preserves the morning scene.

examples.chinese: 我们讨论宋朝的政治(我們討論宋朝的政治)。
examples.english: We discuss the politics of the Song dynasty.

examples.chinese: 他在朝中任职多年(他在朝中任職多年)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài cháo zhōng rènzhí duō nián.
examples.english: He has held office in the court for many years.

examples.chinese: 请把椅子朝窗户摆好(請把椅子朝窗戶擺好)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ yǐzi cháo chuānghu bǎi hǎo.
examples.english: Please position the chair facing the window.
